channel.title: Home on Lélio Chetot
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Lélio Chetot

item.title: About
item.description: Hello ! My name is Lélio Chetot and I'm a PhD student at Inria. I work at CITI lab in the Inria team MARACAS1 Under the supervision of Prof. Jean-Marie Gorce and Dr. Malcolm Egan, I work on detection algorithms in non-coherent multiple access channel using probability, detection and information theories. You can contact me using my email (name.lastname@inria.fr). Models and Algorithms for ReliAble CommunicAtion Systems. ↩︎

item.title: Détecteur pour l'accès aléatoire massif entre machines avec connaissance statistique du canal en lien ascendant
item.description: I went to the French signal processing colloquium as a co-author of a paper about “Random access coding in Multiple Access Network”.

item.title: Coded random access for massive MTC under statistical channel knowledge
item.description: This paper has been presented at the IEEE SPAWC 2019 conference in Marrakech by Diane Duchemin.

item.title: Fundamental Limits in Cellular Networks with Point Process Partial Area Statistics
item.description: I presented my very first paper at the IEEE WiOpt 2019 conference in Avignon.

item.title: ESIT 2019
item.description: I have attended my first European School of Information Theory (ESIT) in Sophia-Antipolis.
